caption:
Are you breaking out with acne around your #FaceMask? We’re seeing a recent trend in what’s called “maskne” (aka #acne caused by wearing face masks). 

#Maskne is usually caused by one of two things (or both): friction or stress. When we wear our masks for long periods of time, they create friction on our sensitive skin. This is why you’ll commonly find “maskne” on your face around where your mask or face shield sits. 

There are several ways to avoid or minimize the severity of any skin breakouts caused by long-term use of face masks. Here are some tips to avoid maskne:

𝗧𝗶𝗽 𝟭. Look at your mask material. 100% cotton allows your skin to breathe better 
𝗧𝗶𝗽 𝟮. Wash your reusable masks frequently
𝗧𝗶𝗽 𝟯. Be mindful of your skincare routine. Rose is a great natural anti-septic 
𝗧𝗶𝗽 𝟰. Rethink your makeup habits by ensuring your cleaning and moisturizing your skin at the end of the day
𝗧𝗶𝗽 𝟱. Reduce your stress by looking for ways to reduce your stress or calm your mind and body 

Check out our latest blog, 5 Tips to Prevent Maskne - and explore  these five tips and gives suggestions on how to prevent Maskne from recurring. Click the link in our bio to read.
